conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volume, and ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and cutaway; corners read as 3D solids. Minor issues: some openings and wall tops are simplified and not consistently detailed.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall arrangement matches (2 bedrooms + central living/dining + kitchen + 2 baths), but balcony/deck areas and some partition placements appear simplified/shifted relative to the 2D plan; door/window placement cannot be verified precisely from the render.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (two beds, sofa/TV zone, dining table). Bathrooms have fixtures. Kitchen is present but cabinetry/appliance layout is simplified versus the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with clean background and adequate lighting; however, some openings (windows/doors) are not clearly distinguishable, reducing architectural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/deck geometry and some internal partition positions appear simplified or shifted compared to the 2D plan.
Doors/windows are not consistently or clearly represented, making opening placement fidelity to the 2D plan uncertain.
Kitchen and some built-ins are simplified; not all 2D-specific fixture/cabinet details are carried into 3D.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with solid spatial depth and correct overall program, but with noticeable simplification/uncertainty in decks and opening/partition fidelity.
